title: username@#$
author: username@#$
content: Anyone have an approx value on this....denarium 1btc funded F0120 L6546....bought it for 5k euros from denarium a few years ago....I see some of the Mike Caldwell cryptos sold for up to 3x at auction but I haven't really  seen any denarium sold and I don't really follow cryptocurrency. Thank you

comments.author: username@#$
comments.body: Quote from: username@#$ on June 13, 2022, 05:31:26 PMAnyone have an approx value on this....denarium 1btc funded F0120 L6546....bought it for 5k euros from denarium a few years ago....I see some of the Mike Caldwell cryptos sold for up to 3x at auction but I haven't really  seen any denarium sold and I don't really follow cryptocurrency. Thank you.   Anyone any ideas? Even a fake value?

comments.author: slimzak
comments.body: I have no idea but id say 1.02 btc

comments.author: Hookzup1
comments.body: Denariums go for peel value, maybe a little more if graded

comments.author: username@#$
comments.body: Thanks for replying lads...now I know my fate!!! Can't work out why Casissus bitcoins can make 3x at auction ie a 1btc funded and mine is close to scrap but eventually I will....emailed that crypto author Elias Ahonen a while back....he said same..close to scrap...jusr needed a second opinion off the experts....will hang on to it....603 Bitcoin showing on Denarium database but they're not updating it if a coin is scrapped Thanks

comments.author: username@#$
comments.body: Thank you for your PM message...Hoodzup1.and the information...didn't know denarium had a bad rep!!! But you're the experts...don't really follow cryptocurrency....it certainly wouldn't be worth what I thought it was worth after reading some of the forum posts....but I'll keep it; hopefully for long term...maybe if some of them were auctioned publicly like the Cassucus ones might be worth a little more than peel value ...also didn't know you could buy factory funded crypto items....best of luck in the Cryptocurrency World....

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: I've haven't sold 1btc funded, but I've sold over 20 .01 btc funded for around 1.86-4.09x ball park. Fractionals can bring higher premiums to the whole bitcoin. Casascius is the original bitcoin and will most likely always bring a higher premium. I have never had a issue with Denarium. It might be a little slower right now because we are in a bear market.

comments.author: username@#$
comments.body: Thanks Carribean....nice your selling...according to my novice research there also Bitcoin gold, diamonds and cash arced onto it so I would hope it's not a scrap/well above scrap etc
